instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesn’t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard, then no backlight
threads.message: Hi I have this board which was liquid damaged by customer, first it didn´t turn on, then it turned on and had no trackpad or keyboard, now I changed <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> / <TRANSISTOR>Q5701</TRANSISTOR> / <CHIP>U5750</CHIP> and have a working keyboard/trackpad but no backlight... I even have  <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> at 55v, but no backlight, just get the image in the back...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no keyboard, then no backlight
threads.message:
55V on backlight output, means the LEDs strip connection is lost.
Bad LEDs strip, video cable, or LCD connector.
Try known good LCD assembly first.
